Stem: Hairless, 4-angled, many branched towards top. Green or reddish becoming rounded and woody with age.
Leaves: Stalkless, glossy, alternate along stem, elongated lance-shaped, 5-35 cm long.
Flowers: Single and yellow, between leaf and stem, with 4 or 5 petals with prominet veins.
FruitSeeds: Becoming light brown as they mature, sharply 4-angled with large numbers of tiny seeds in 4 sections.
DistinguishingFeatures: Less hairy stems, leaves and fruit than native and other invasive Primrose willows.
